Key Match Events: Jhonkensy Noel's go-ahead RBI single in the seventh inning
Andrés Giménez's leaping catch to end the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians were on the verge of being swept by Kansas City for the first time since June 1973
Manager Stephen Vogt acknowledged the need for his team to step back, exhale, and play the way they did the first five months of the season
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland's bats finally came alive and managed to take the finale, 7-5
The win gave Cleveland a one-game lead over Kansas City in the AL Central
It was a confidence booster at the most critical point of the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trailing by three runs, a leadoff homer by Bo Naylor brought some energy to the home dugout
The offense racked up six hits in the seventh inning, the most in a single inning for the Guardians all year
Emmanuel Clase recorded his American League-best 39th save, lowering his ERA to 0.58
